Notes/Rationale: Positive, uplifting, can be grand or gentle.
Light-hearted, playful, often upbeat.
Intense, high energy, often fast and loud, minor key can add tension.
Agitated, moderate to high energy, can be repetitive or slightly dissonant.
Positive, confirming, generally pleasant.
Warm, gentle, often slower and softer, acoustic elements common.
Unsettled, perhaps slightly dissonant or rhythmically complex.
Inquisitive, exploring, can have interesting textures or progressions.
Yearning, passionate, often rhythmic and can build in intensity.
Low energy, somber, reflective of unfulfilled expectation.
Critical, somewhat stern, not aggressive but firm.
Aversive, potentially harsh sounds, strong rejection.
Awkward, perhaps a bit hesitant or self-conscious.
High energy, fast tempo, very positive and anticipatory.
Tense, can be quiet and suspenseful or loud and sudden. Minor key typical.
Thankful, warm, heartfelt, often melodic and uplifting.
Deep sadness, very low energy, slow, often acoustic or orchestral.
Pure happiness, high valence and energy, often upbeat and melodic.
Warm, encompassing, can be gentle or passionate.
Agitated, restless, tempo might feel hurried.
Balanced, not strongly emotional, often instrumental or ambient.
Hopeful, forward-looking, bright sounding.
Confident, strong, can have a triumphant or stately feel.
Epiphany, can be calm or slightly dramatic depending on the realization.
Exhale, calming down after tension, often melodic and reassuring.
Regretful, somber, introspective, similar to sadness but with guilt.
Low valence and energy, often slow, minor key, acoustic often fits.
Can be sudden, unexpected changes in dynamics or rhythm. Valence depends on type of surprise.
